data.author: Lee Chong Ming
data.title: The US is taking a stake in a chip startup led by Intel's ousted CEO
data.description: The US is investing up to $150 million in xLight, a chip startup chaired by former Intel CEO Pat Gelsinger, to boost domestic chipmaking.
data.content:
The US is taking an equity stake in a chip startup led by Intel's former CEO Pat Gelsinger as it tries to reclaim leadership in the semiconductor race.I-HWA CHENG/AFP via Getty Images

data.author: Bloomberg
data.title: Jane Street trading revenue rises 18%, on pace for record year
data.description: Jane Street’s tally for the first nine months topped $24 billion — more than the $20.5 billion it notched for all of last year
data.content: Jane Street Group raked in $6.83 billion of net trading revenue in the third quarter, ranking among Wall Streets largest firms as it heads for a record year, according to people with knowledge of the… [+2403 chars]

data.author: Zoe Tillman, Jaewon Kang, Bloomberg
data.title: Costco joins companies suing for refunds if Trump’s tariffs fall
data.description: It’s one of the biggest corporate players to jump into a fight largely driven this year by small businesses and Democratic state officials.
